tn.text: This refers to the land across the Jordan River, to the east of Israel. Moses was east of the Jordan when he spoke to the Israelites. AT: "east of the Jordan"

tn.ref: Suph ... Paran ... Tophel ... Laban ... Hazeroth ... Di Zahab
tn.text: These are the names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names|How to Translate Names]])

tn.ref: It is eleven days' journey from Horeb ... to Kadesh Barnea
tn.text: "It takes eleven days to walk from Horeb ... to Kadesh Barnea"
This is a mountainous area south of the Dead Sea. The area is also called "Edom." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"11" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers|Numbers]])

tn.ref: It happened in the fortieth year, in the eleventh month, on the first day of the month, that Moses spoke
tn.text: The ordinal numbers can be translated as cardinal numbers. AT: "They had lived in the wilderness for 40 years, 11 months, and 1 day, when Moses spoke" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
40th (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: in the eleventh month, on the first day of the month
tn.text: This is the eleventh month of the Hebrew calendar. The first day is near the middle of January on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
11th (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This is the name of God that he revealed to his people in the Old Testament. See the translationWord page about Yahweh concerning how to translate this.
"Yahweh had enabled the Israelites to defeat"
These are names of kings. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are names of cities. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

This refers to the land across the Jordan River, to the east of Israel. Moses was east of the Jordan when he said this. AT: "East of the Jordan River." Translate this as it is in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:01:01|1:1]].
The word "us" refers to Moses and the other people of Israel.

tn.ref: You have lived long enough in this hill country
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "You do not need to stay near this mountain any longer" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Moses continues to remind the people of Israel what Yahweh said to them.
The word "turn" is an idiom for beginning action. AT: "Start again on your journey" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Yahweh is describing places in the land that he has promised to give to the Israelites.
This is an area in the hills near the place where the Amorites lived.
an area of land that is low and flat
"Pay attention to what I am about to say"

tn.ref: I have set the land before you
tn.text: "I am now giving this land to you"
Yahweh is speaking as if he were another person. AT: "that I, Yahweh, swore" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pronouns]])
The word "fathers" is a synecdoche for all ancestors. AT: "ancestors" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Moses continues to remind the people of Israel what Yahweh said to them.

tn.ref: I spoke to you at that time
tn.text: Here "I" refers to Moses. The phrase "at that time" refers to when the Israelites were at Horeb, which is the same as Mount Sinai. AT: "When we were at Horeb, I spoke to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: I am not able to carry you myself alone
tn.text: Here "to carry you" means "to lead you" or "to govern you." AT: "It is too much for me to lead you by myself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: as the multitude of the stars of heaven
tn.text: This is an exaggeration that means God has greatly increased the number of Israelites. AT: "a great crowd of many people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
The phrase "a thousand" is a metaphor for "very many." AT: "very many times" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
1000 (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
Moses continues speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: But how can I myself alone carry your loads, your burdens, and your disputes?
tn.text: Moses uses a question to emphasize that he cannot solve all of their problems by himself. This rhetorical question can be translated as a statement. AT: "I cannot carry your loads, your burdens, and your disputes by myself." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

Moses speaks as if the people's problems and complaints that he needed to take care of were heavy physical objects that he had been carrying. AT: "take care of your problems, your complaints" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"your arguments" or "your disagreements"

tn.ref: men of good repute from each tribe
tn.text: "men from each tribe whom the people of Israel respect"
Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel.
"and men whom your people respected." See how this is translated in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:01:12|1:13]].

tn.ref: of thousands ... of hundreds ... of fifties ... of tens
tn.text: "of groups of 1,000 ... of groups of 100 ... of groups of 50 ... and groups of 10" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
These are titles for different leaders in Israel's government.
"from each of your tribes"

tn.ref: judge righteously between a man and his brother
tn.text: "make right and fair decisions about the disputes Israelites have with each other"
Moses continues speaking to the judges, so the commands are plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pronouns]])
"Do not show partiality"

tn.ref: you will hear the small and the great alike
tn.text: These two extremes "small" and "great" represent all people. AT: "you will treat all people alike" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: You will not be afraid of the face of man
tn.text: The word "face" is a metonym for the whole person. "You will not" is a command. "Do not be afraid of anyone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This means the time when they were at Horeb, at Mount Sinai. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Moses continues reminding the people of Israel what the previous generation of Israelites did.
"large and dangerous desert that you crossed through"
Moses continues reminding the people of Israel what the previous generation of Israelites did.

tn.ref: Look ... your God ... before you; go up, take possession ... your fathers ... to you; do not be afraid, neither be discouraged
tn.text: Moses is speaking to the Israelites as if he were speaking to one man, so these forms should be singular, not plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pronouns]]).

tn.ref: has set the land before you
tn.text: "is now giving this land to you." See how this is translated in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:01:07|1:8]].
Moses continues reminding the people of Israel what the previous generation of Israelites did.
"12 men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"They left that place and went" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This is a valley in the Hebron region, which is south of Jerusalem. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"looked for places they could attack"
Moses continues reminding the people of Israel what the previous generation of Israelites did.
"The 12 men took"

tn.ref: took some of the produce of the land in their hands
tn.text: "picked some of the produce of the land"
The speaker speaks as if a "word" were a physical object that someone could bring. AT: "told us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: said, 'It is a good land that Yahweh our God is giving to us.'
tn.text: The direct quotation can be translated as an indirect quotation. AT: "said that the land that Yahweh our God was giving to us was good"
Moses continues reminding the people of Israel what the previous generation of Israelites did.
God commanded the Israelites to attack and destroy the Amorites, but the Israelites were afraid and refused to fight them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: into the hand of the Amorites
tn.text: Here "into the hand" means to give the Amorites power over them. AT: "into the power of the Amorites" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here this question emphasizes how afraid they were. This rhetorical question can be translated as a statement. AT: "We have nowhere to go." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
This means that they became afraid. AT: "made us very afraid" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: and are fortified up to the heavens
tn.text: This is an exaggeration that emphasizes how frightened the people were because the cities were so large and strong. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
"have walls that are as high as"
These are descendants of the Anak people who were very large and fierce. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Moses continues reminding the people of Israel what the previous generation of Israelites did.
"I said to your ancestors"
Here the metonym "before your eyes" refers to what they saw. AT: "which you yourselves saw" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: you have seen ... Yahweh your God carried you ... you went ... you came
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so all instances of "you" and "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: Yahweh your God carried you, as a man carries his son
tn.text: Here Yahweh's care for his people is compared to that of a father. AT: "Yahweh your God has taken care of you, like a father takes care of his son" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: until you came to this place
tn.text: "until you came to this land that God promised to give you"
Moses continues reminding the people of Israel what the previous generation of Israelites did.

tn.ref: Yahweh your God ... who went before you
tn.text: Moses reminds them of all the ways Yahweh had gone ahead of Israel during all their travels in the past.
"put up your tents"
Moses continues to remind the people of Israel what Yahweh said to them.

tn.ref: heard the sound of your words
tn.text: "heard what you were saying"
God made a vow not to allow those who rebelled against him to enter the land he promised to give them.
"will enter"
"except Caleb"
This is the name of Caleb's father. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Yahweh speaks as if he were someone else. AT: "he has completely obeyed me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pronouns]])
Moses continues reminding the people of Israel what the previous generation of Israelites did.

tn.ref: Yahweh was angry with me because of you
tn.text: This refers to when Moses disobeyed what Yahweh told him to do because Moses was angry with the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This is the name of Joshua's father. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Why Joshua stands before Moses can be stated clearly. AT: "who stands before you as your servant" or "who helps you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Moses continues reminding the people of Israel what the previous generation of Israelites did.

tn.ref: no knowledge of good or evil
tn.text: They do not yet know what is good and what is evil.
"turn around and go back on the road you have come on"
Moses continues reminding the people of Israel what the previous generation of Israelites did.
"we have rebelled against Yahweh by disobeying him"
"we will obey"
Here the metonym "hill country" represents the people that live there. AT: "to attack the people who live in the hill country" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: for I will not be with you, and you will be defeated by your enemies
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "your enemies will defeat you because I will not be with you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel.
The metonym "hill country" stands for the people who live there. AT: "attacked the people who live in the hill country" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

A "bee" is a small, flying insect that flies in large groups and stings people who threaten them. This means that so many Amorites  attacked the Israelite soldiers that they had to leave the battle. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
This is the name of a piece of land. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a city. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"killed many of your soldiers"
Moses continues reminding the people of Israel what the previous generation of Israelites did.
"returned to Kadesh"
